questions.question: Who is the Presidential candidate fielded by the New Independent Front Party?
questions.answer: Oshala Herath.

questions.question: When did the New Independent Front Party decide to field Oshala Herath as their Presidential candidate?
questions.answer: On June 13 during its Executive Committee meeting.

questions.question: What is the legal status of the New Independent Front Party?
questions.answer: It is an independent and recognized party under the Parliamentary Elections Act, No. 1 of 1981.

questions.question: What notable action did Oshala Herath take against former Parliamentarian Diana Gamage?
questions.answer: He challenged Diana Gamage's Parliamentary seat over possessing dual citizenship.

questions.question: What was the outcome of the court case filed by Oshala Herath against Diana Gamage?
questions.answer: The Supreme Court announced that Diana Gamage was not eligible to hold a seat in the Parliament of Sri Lanka due to her British Citizenship.

questions.question: Which party is Oshala Herath representing in the upcoming Presidential Election?
questions.answer: The New Independent Front Party.

questions.question: On what grounds did Oshala Herath challenge Diana Gamage's eligibility for Parliament?
questions.answer: On the grounds of dual citizenship, specifically her British Citizenship.

questions.question: What role did the Supreme Court play in the case involving Diana Gamage?
questions.answer: The Supreme Court determined that Diana Gamage was ineligible to hold a seat in the Sri Lankan Parliament due to her British Citizenship.

questions.question: What legislative act recognizes the New Independent Front Party?
questions.answer: The Parliamentary Elections Act, No. 1 of 1981.

questions.question: What was the position of Diana Gamage that Oshala Herath contested?
questions.answer: State Minister and member of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB).

questions.question: What action has the New Independent Front (NIF) requested from the Election Commission regarding SJB leaders?
questions.answer: The NIF has requested the Election Commission to take action against SJB leader Sajith Premadasa and SJB General Secretary Ranjith Madduma Bandara for their failure to address the issue of ousted State Minister Diana Gamage, despite knowing she was a British citizen.

questions.question: Who is the Chairman of the New Independent Front (NIF)?
questions.answer: Oshala Herath.

questions.question: When did Oshala Herath send a letter to the Election Commission Chairman regarding Diana Gamage?
questions.answer: On June 3, 2024.

questions.question: What legislative act does Oshala Herath believe should be used to address the issue with SJB leaders?
questions.answer: The Parliamentary Elections Act (No 1 of 1981).

questions.question: What specific failure of the SJB leaders is Oshala Herath highlighting in his request to the Election Commission?
questions.answer: The failure of the SJB leaders to move court against Diana Gamage and to inform the Election Commission of her foreign citizenship.

questions.question: Who was appointed to fill the vacancy created by Diana Gamage’s removal?
questions.answer: Mujibur Rahuman.

questions.question: What did Oshala Herath claim to have done regarding Diana Gamage’s citizenship status?
questions.answer: He claimed that he personally briefed SJB leader Sajith Premadasa and General Secretary Ranjith Madduma Bandara about Diana Gamage’s citizenship status.

questions.question: What Articles of the Parliamentary Elections Act does Oshala Herath request the Election Commission to use against the SJB leaders?
questions.answer: Articles 18, 43, and 66.

questions.question: What was Oshala Herath’s role in the 2020 general election?
questions.answer: He contested the election on the UNP ticket from the Colombo District.

questions.question: What was Oshala Herath’s role in the government prior to his involvement in the recent issue with Diana Gamage?
questions.answer: He served as a social media advisor to President Maithripala Sirisena.
